definition: to take aim at/to target
to take aim/(fig.) to aim one's looks at/to glance at
accurate/standard/definitely/certainly/about to become (bride, son-in-law etc)/quasi-/para-
telescopic sight/scope (on a rifle)
sighting device/sight (for a firearm etc)
to aim in front of a moving target

sentences.english: Riflemen at the embankment also had cut holes through which they could aim and fire.
sentences.chinese: 堤岸上來復槍手開好了瞄準射擊的射孔。

sentences.english: He aimed with accuracy of a sharpshooter .
sentences.chinese: 他似神槍手你的精度瞄準。

sentences.english: If you would hit the mark, you must aim a little above it.
sentences.chinese: 要向射靶，必需瞄準比靶稍微高些。

sentences.english: The gyroscope in tank is used to stabilize the aim system of the gun.
sentences.chinese: 坦克中的陀螺儀用於穩定火炮的瞄準系統。

sentences.english: Polish your presentations and deliver them enthusiastically to the right market.
sentences.chinese: 做好你的自我介紹，並切要瞄準適當的市場。

sentences.english: The albino drew a pistol from his coat and aimed the barrel through the bars, directly at the curator.
sentences.chinese: 他從外套中拔出手槍，將槍管透過鐵欄杆瞄準了館長。

sentences.english: I aimed the gun carefully at the target.
sentences.chinese: 我小心地用槍瞄準了目標。

sentences.english: She aimed at the target but missed it.
sentences.chinese: 她瞄準目標射擊，但沒打中。

sentences.english: In the distant targets at the same time, don't think slightingly of the nearby.
sentences.chinese: 在瞄準遙遠目標的同時，不要輕視近處的東西。

sentences.english: One must sight carefully before firing his gun.
sentences.chinese: 在放槍前一定要仔細地瞄準。

sentences.english: Improved Barrage now affects Aimed Shot.
sentences.chinese: “強化彈幕”現在影響瞄準射擊。

sentences.english: According to the detection method , it has designed a set of detection systems of photoelectric helmet sighting device.
sentences.chinese: 根據檢測方法，設計了一套光電頭盔瞄準具檢測系統。

sentences.english: The larva takes aim at the snail's tentacles. It strikes with its poison nippers.
sentences.chinese: 小螢火蟲瞄準了蝸牛的觸角，並用自己帶毒的螯出擊。

sentences.english: Many of these targeted places on the malarial parasite different from the places targeted by current drugs.
sentences.chinese: 其中許多化合物瞄準了不同於目前藥物的瘧原蟲部位。

sentences.english: Sometimes allowance for the curvature of the trajectory was made by "sighting by the line of metal."
sentences.chinese: 有時會以“炮身瞄準“方式來補償不平直的彈道。

definition: to aim at/to target/to point at/to be directed at/registration/alignment (mechanical engineering)

to lock (a door)/to close with a latch/to lock into place/a lock/a latch/to lock a computer file (to prevent it being overwritten)/to lock (denying access to a computer system or device or files, e.g. by password-protection)/to focus attention on/to target
to drive/to propel/drive (vehicle wheel)/drive mechanism (tape or disk)/device driver (computing software)
strategy
to change direction/fig. to change one's stance
to get lost/to lose one's way
to follow a trail/to trace/to pursue
to observe and make sure/to check
to put to use/to apply/practical/applied (science, linguistics etc)/application/practical use/(computing) app
software (Tw)/soft-bodied (animal)
to push (for acceptance of a plan)/to push forward/to promote/to actuate/CL:個|个[ge4]
to recommend/to introduce (from outside)
accurate/exact/precise/precision
investment/to invest
innovation/to bring forth new ideas/to blaze new trails
transformation/to transform
to shoot/to fire (a gun)
